page.title: 14Life At Elford Manor
page.content: Miss Mary Dyott is the grandaughter of the last Lord of the Manor of Elford. She has told us many interesting facts about life at the hall when she was a girl and the changes she has seen in her life.When she stayed at the hall there was of course no central heating,no light other than candles and no bathrooms.There were however 3 water closets.The water for these and the taps in the kitchen and pantry was pumped up by hand to a tank in the house twice a day.One of the many things she remembers was that everyone dressed for dinner even if it was quite a simple meal.One of the puddings they often had was fresh Angelica tart.The Angelica was grown in the gardens.
